name: Women, Gender and Environmental (In)Justice
description: An examination of the impact the environment has on our gendered lives. Current, historical and transnational perspectives will be addressed. Topics will include: the impact of environmental degradation on gendered bodies; planning for safer places; global sustainable development; ecofeminism; the gender division of spaces.
prerequisites: 1.5 credits in WST courses, 1.0 credit of which must be at the B- and/or C-level
